Name: Stela
Description: Round-topped sandstone stela, lacking lower right edge, bearing on one face a depiction of a standing man facing right, holding a duck or goose in each hand as an offering, and at the right edge, a column of hieroglyphs facing left, recording the name of the man, Dedusebek. The stela was found by Flinders Petrie at the shrine of the goddess Hathor on the Sinai plateau at Sarabit el-Khadim. Dedusebek was presumably one of the expeditionaries sent in especially large numbers during the late Middle Kingdom to procure turquoise, copper ore and other raw materials for the Egyptian treasury.
